properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 9 at 2:53PM MST until February 10 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW OVER PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL
NEW MEXICO TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING...

...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS THEN ARRIVE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...

.An upper level disturbance and surface cold front will combine
to bring light to occasionally moderate snow to portions of
western and central New Mexico later tonight through Monday
morning. Areas most likely to observe accumulations will be found
along the central mountain chain. A brief break in the wintry weather
is then expected Monday afternoon, however a more significant
winter storm will move over New Mexico Monday night through
Tuesday night when many areas of northern and central New Mexico
can expect moderate to heavy snowfall and colder temperatures. In
addition, periods of strong and gusty winds will create areas of
blowing snow in central New Mexico. Residents and travelers
through much of northern and central New Mexico can expect
significant travel impacts Monday night through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts
of 3 to 5 inches above 7500 feet. For the Winter Storm Watch,
heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches,
except 8 to 12 inches above 7500 feet possible Locally higher
amounts may be possible above 10,000 feet.

* WHERE...South Central Mountains.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to
noon MST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday evening
afternoon through Tuesday evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Monday
night through Tuesday night.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
